author: Special Correspondent
text:
Offerings like currency and gold made by devotees being counted at Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple in Srirangamon Wednesday.— Photo:M.Srinath

Volunteers and employees of Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowment Department counted the ‘hundial’ collection at Srirangam Sri Ranganathaswamy temple on Wednesday.

Cash totalling Rs.84,56,813, gold weighing 155 grams and silver weighing 895 grams were collected through 40 ‘hundials’ of the temple. Besides, 495 foreign currencies were also got on the occasion.

P. Jayaraman, Joint Commissioner and Executive Officer of the temple, supervised the arrangements for the collection.
title: Hundial collection being counted
